intro: Breynia shawii, commonly known as the Shining Breynia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas or disturbed soils. Breynia shawii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
